member.name: T:Proyecto1.My.MyWpfExtension
member.summary: Módulo utilizado para definir las propiedades disponibles en el espacio de nombres My de WPF

member.summary: Devuelve el objeto de aplicación de la aplicación en ejecución

member.name: P:Proyecto1.My.MyWpfExtension.Computer
member.summary: Devuelve información sobre el equipo host.

member.name: P:Proyecto1.My.MyWpfExtension.User
member.summary: Devuelve información sobre el usuario actual. Si desea ejecutar la aplicación con las credenciales del usuario de Windows actual, llame a My.User.InitializeWithWindowsUser().

member.name: P:Proyecto1.My.MyWpfExtension.Log
member.summary: Devuelve el registro de la aplicación. El archivo de configuración de la aplicación puede configurar los agentes de escucha.

member.name: P:Proyecto1.My.MyWpfExtension.Windows
member.summary: Devuelve la colección de Windows definida en el proyecto.

member.summary: Clase de recurso fuertemente tipado, para buscar cadenas traducidas, etc.

member.name: P:Proyecto1.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Devuelve la instancia de ResourceManager almacenada en caché utilizada por esta clase.

member.name: P:Proyecto1.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Reemplaza la propiedad CurrentUICulture del subproceso actual para todas las búsquedas de recursos mediante esta clase de recurso fuertemente tipado.

member.name: T:Proyecto1.Archer
member.summary: The archer is a unit that attacks from a distance. He does not lock the enemy. He is not able to defend himself at close range, so he is advised to be in the rearguard or protected by structures. He has two types of shot: - A stronger one that will prevent him from moving. This one is effective against armored units (knights). - A weaker one that does not reduce his mobility.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Archer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:Proyecto1.Troop
member.summary: Superclass of all game units.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Troop.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Troop.FinishTurn
member.summary: Procedure executed at the end of the turn. Moves = 0, NO rotation, NO build, NO demolish, NO shoot.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Troop.StartTurn
member.summary: The unit starts with all the base attributes prepared for the new turn.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Troop.Rotate
member.summary: Change the positioning and formation of the unit to be able to lock enemies. The rotation is according to the clockwise direction. There are units (archers, engineers...) that do not rotate.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Troop.AdjacentEnemies(System.Object)
member.summary: Function that controls if the unit has an adjacent enemy. If so, the allied unit is locked in combat and can not move!!

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Troop.GetStructure(System.Windows.Controls.Grid@)
member.summary: Function with which the name of the structure on which the character is obtained.
member.param: All the cells of the battlefield.
member.returns: The name of the structure on which the character

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Engineer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:Proyecto1.Knight
member.summary: Some think it's the best unit in the game... They are not very wrong. Knights are the most mobile unit. They have a special defense against arrows. The weak points are the towers and the fortresses. A knight can not enter them.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Knight.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:Proyecto1.Lancer
member.summary: The spearman is a... somewhat pathetic troop. Attack at close range. He has a poor movement. It does not stand out in anything! On the other hand, there are many of them. When the adversary begins to build an imposing system of structures (where knights and archers become useless), this infantry can assault him and destroy his defenses. The closed formations of lancers become impenetrable to enemy cavalry, but they are weak to the arrows!

member.name: M:Proyecto1.Lancer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: BattleWindow

member.name: M:Proyecto1.BattleWindow.Character_Selection(System.Windows.Controls.Image,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that is executed when selecting a character.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.BattleWindow.MoveOrShoot(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that is executed when clicking the secondary button of the mouse. It allows the character to move to an adyascent cell or shoot.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.BattleWindow.Aim(System.Windows.Controls.Image,System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that paints a shooting target on the unit to which we want to shoot.
member.param: Cell on which we want to shoot.
It is useless, but it is required.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.BattleWindow.BtnEndTurn_Click(System.Object,System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that occurs when the button to end the turn is pressed. Finish your turn!
member.param: The button that is pressed to finish your turn.
It is useless, but it is required.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.BattleWindow.BuildOrDemolish(System.Windows.Controls.Button,System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that occurs when a construction button is pressed. This allows to build or destroy structures.
member.param: The button that is pressed to build the structure.
It is useless, but it is required.

member.name: M:Proyecto1.BattleWindow.MouseLeaving(System.Windows.Controls.Image,System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Method whose actions occur when the mouse leaves a cell. Paint the cell with the image of the unit that is in it. Clear the images that are created when you point with arrows.
member.param: The cell from which we left.
It is useless, but it is required.

member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.param: The cell from which we left.
